eu_initiatives: BCI's prospective activities with the EU’s institutions is  made up of the assistance we are aiming to provide to an indigenous minority group in Libya seeking to meet with EU actors to inform them of the plights and injustices faced by the group in their own country. BCI are planning to, for the first time, meet with EU officials to facilitate and discuss the situation on the ground, the human rights violations and the EU’s overall strategy for Libya. This is the extent to which, we hope, to interact with the EU and its institutions.
relevant_communication: "Post Revolution Pioneers: Emerging Opportunities and Implications for Libyan Women and Civil Society" 2018 report for the Institute for War and Peace Reporting
goals__remit: BCI is an international development and political consultancy providing advice, analysis, training, and research in strategic communications, programme design, public opinion research, elections, monitoring and evaluation, women’s political participation, political strategy and organizational training. BCI’s sectorial focuses are the areas of democratization, elections, political parties, good governance, civil society and NGOs, gender and advocacy. Senior consultants are experts in the company's sectoral focus, having worked to develop the capacity of various actors in emerging and transitional democracies. Combining decades of years of experience from some of the most challenging political environments, BCI has the right mix of talent and understanding to deliver expert advice and action and is a small but well-networked company that is flexible enough to respond quickly to the needs of clients. BCI’s geographical work is focused on but is not limited to the MENA and Balkans regions.
